1.content:
Another thing about Lianna: She gets all A's and drives her teachers crazy because it doesn't look like she is paying any attention, and half the time she isn't. She spends a lot of time in detention as well.

Now, what are you doing today?
1.title: Oh, yeah one more thing

choices: Stay in your room and watch T.V
Go outside and meet your friends
11.content:
You turn the next page and look at the pictures. They are all of you as a baby. You've had it ever since you can remember. You turn the page. One of the pictures is of you on a tricycle and a woman beside you. She has her head turned away from the camera. You are positive this is your mother, she has the same pitch black hair as you - minus the silver streaks. You reach your hand over to turn to the last page, the page that must have a picture with your mother facing the camera, and stop. Your hand shakes ever so slightly. You close the album quickly and put it on the shelf above your bed. You have had that photo album for as long as you can remember, and for as long as you can remember you've never been able to bring yourself to turn that one page.
"It's not like she's ever given me a reason to want to know," you tell the album.
11.title: 'I don't need to know'

choices: She blacks put before she can **que dream sequance**
111.content:
Lianna reached out for her guitar and she felt the cool strings underneath her fingers vibrate slightly, beckoning to be played. She closed her eyes and rested her hand on the neck and stroked a string softly. A pure note came out and seemed to call out "Lianna".
She snapped open her eyes and looked at the string. It was still vibrating a little untill Lianna stopped it. SHe stroked the string again, but only heard a note, not her name but a simple note. She looked at the album and cursed silently.
"I gotta look at that last page! But...I don't want to see what's on the oter side." Lianna whispered to no one in particular. She grabbed the album and started to turn the last page.
111.title: Lianna and her guitar

1111.content:
Something hits you on the back of the head, knocking you out. You fall to the bed.

You're at a graveyard, it looks like it's going to rain.
('When your father died it was like the heavens grieved')
There are people standing around a fresh grave, a funeral. In the front is a woman holding the hand of a little girl. The little girl is you, and this is the thing you can remember before the orpahange, the one that makes you think your father is dead. The woman has your black hair. She has her head turned down and away from the coffin, away from you, crying. The younger you is crying as well, but you're looking at the coffin.
1111.title: The dream/memory

11111.content: "Lee, Lee, wake up Lee," a voise says. A hand shaes you out of the strange dream/memory. You can't help but feel like you should have stayed longer, like you missed something. You open your eyes and see...
11111.title: Waking up

112.content:
You turn your back on the album, you don't want to think about, and pull on your sneakers. You grab your jean jacket and your guitar and violin case. As you make your way to the front door you pass the living room, Dave is there watching T.V.
"Hey Dave, I'm going out," you tell him.
"Hold on a second," He says, getting up, "You're not going anywhere..."
112.title: Staying home

1121.content:
"What?" you demand, "A babysitter! Dave I'm sixteen for God's sake I don't need a babysitter."
"We are going out and we don't want you getting into any trouble, you're grounded remember?" Mary comes out, wearing a dress.
"Fine," you mutter and call Natalie, "Hey Nat? It's me, Lee. I can't meet the band... Yeah and a babysitter, no matter I need to practice my violin... Yep, see ya at school." You hang up and go to your room.

You turn on the small T.V in your room to CMT. It's showing the Dixie Chicks singing "Goodbye Earl" You smile, this is a funny song. You take out your violin and play "Cowboy take me away" By the Dixie Chicks.

After a while you hear Dave and Mary talking to somebody, the babysitter. After a few more minutes, you are going through the song again and this time humming the words, there is a knock on the door. You stop playing, "Door's open." That door opens and you see...
1121.title: The babysitter

choices: He doesn't know you forged it
You leave before he can tell you anything
12.content:
"Hey Lee." You look around to find the person that called you. It's Jasmin, one of your friends. She has blonde hair and green eyes.
"What?" You open your locker and dig around for your books.
"Hall is looking for you. Want's that test you had to get signed."
"Oh yeah, thanks." You take the test out of your backpack and write Daves name on the line, just as Mr. Hall, the math teacher, turns the courner. You hold it out as he comes.
12.title: Mr. Hall

choices: you are stunned and very sorry
you feel empowered and want more
121.content:
You carelessly sling the test at Mr. Hall. You can tell by the way that he looks at the test and then at you that he knows you faked the signature; but what do you care? Besides, he should be happy that he gets that much creative writing from you anyway. The girl, Jasmine, is still talking, or maybe she's not, but you walk away just the same.
You pass the pillars of flesh that will someday be kicked out of the finest colleges in America. You pass the walking wads of soiled paper that make up your generation.
You pass the bathroom where you intended to cop a butt and, turning on your heel, walk directly into a cardboard cut-out of Goato, the school's mascot, and fall.
There is a blazing silence before the storm of leering pours on you. You are acutley aware of your aching knees on the gritty linolium, and you can feel the stab of tears start in the back of your head. You gather you books as the laughing starts, trying to make them think that you don't care so that you can beleive it. Here comes Hall with his hand out and teacher-mask on, offering to help you up and to class. You heft your Civics book and swing it at his face, shattering the bridge of his nose with a bloody pop.
121.title: success

123.content:
As Mr. Hall looks at the test you grab your books and head for your next class.
"Does Dave or Mary even know you had a test?" Jasmin asks as to walk quickly down the hall.
"If they did do you think they'd care?" you ask.
"Just enough to yell at you." You both laugh. Dave and Mary being your parents is a joke in your little group, not that you mind.
You take a seat in the back of the class with your other friends, Buddy, Natalie, Jasmin, and TJ.

What is the class?
123.title: Class

choices: Someone is here to meet you
1232.content:
Your first class is science. You barely listen to the teachers seemingly endless dron, only paying attention to the key points.

TJ nudges you and puts some paper in your hand. 'The band's meeting in the park after school, u game?' You crumple the piece of paper and nod, pretending to show the teacher that you understand him.

The bell, finall, rings and everyone gets up to leave.
"Lianna, a moment," The teacher Mr. Jones says. You walk up to his desk...
1232.title: Mr. Jones

12321.content:
You wait for Mr. Lones to say what you did.
"You didn't bring the test your parents had to sign did you?" He looks at you from over his glasses
You smack your hand on your forehead, "Ohhhh, Mr. Jones I left it at home." Mr. jones goes into a long speech about how that's not a good enough excuse, and how you have to remember things, and how your boss isn't going to take any of this, blah, blah, blah. You nod at the right times.
12321.title: No test

13.content:
You finish playing 'The rock show' by Blink 182. The few people that have stayed for the whole song clap and throw money into your cases.
"Okay, what else do y'all want to hear?" Buddy Harris calls. Buddy and you are the ones that sing. Buddy plays guitar too.
"Anyone? We'll play anything we know, and we know a lot!" Jasmin O'Neil, who plays drums, says. No one says anything, "Don't make us choose a song. If we do pick a song you'll be paying us to stop, and we don't stop until the song is done," you call. You don't have microphones so you need to raise your voice.
"Britany Spears!" someone shouts.
"Do I look like I'm going to sing Britany Spears? Get out of here!" Some people laugh.
You spend a few more minutes waiting for people to name a song.
Finally someone you can't see calls, "'Cowboy take me away'."
"Hey Lee, isn't that a group you like," Buddy asks.
"Yeah, Dixie Chicks," To whoever said it you say, "Sorry, me'n'Jasmin are the only ones that know it."
"So, we've played songs without the right instruments before. C'mon Lee no one says country," Natalie Heart says, she plays flute and guitar.
13.title: Songs

131.content:
You shrug, "Alright, sure." You and Jasmin do the best you can to play the music while you sing.

You are half way through it when you glance at the crowd and see the top of a head of black hair, as black as yours. You don't think anything of it, lots of people have black hair. You glance to your right and see TJ, who plays guitar, nudges Buddy and Natalie and jerks his head in the direction of the black-haired head.
131.title: A head in the crowd

choices: Spend the evening away from home, trying to lighten your mood
Spend the evening at home, trying to lighten your mood
1312.content:
You don't give the black-haired head another thought but 'I'm not the only one that likes country'.
When you all decide to pack up and go home you split up the monry you've collected as best you can.
You are helping Jasmin pack her drums when TJ says, "Hey Lee, did you see that person who wanted to hear 'Cowboy take me away'?"
"No, why?"
"Did you not see that person with the black hair. I swear it was as black as yours." Buddy says.
"I saw that top of their head. My hair is not some special shade of black, just black. And lots of people have black hair." You put the stool you sit on by the wall with the rest of them.
"Girl, you have the darkest black hair I have ever seen. And whoever that was in the crowd had the same dark black hair," Natalie says, TJ and Bud nod.
You know where this is going and you don't like it, "Look you guys I know what you're thinking and it's not gonna happen. I've been living with Dave and Mary ever since I was seven, after two years in the orphanage. If she wanted to find me it wouldn't be that hard. I mean, how many black haired, amber eyed girls are out there? She's not coming." With that you grab your guitar and violin cases and walk off.
"Lighten up, Lee. She's your mother after all." Jasmin calls. You walk a bit faster, you don't like talking about your real mother.
1312.title: Bad mood

choices: No, your mood still isn't better
Yes, you've had a bad history with cops and the dark
13121.content:
You spend the rest of the evening at the park, playing your guitar and violin, alternating between the two.


When you've finally stopped playing it's gotten dark, really dark.

Should you go home?
13121.title: Go home?

choices: Do you go up to your room?
Do you go to the kitchen
13122.content: You walk home as fast as you can. Why would she try and find you? She probably doesn't even remember you, right? I mean, why would she put you up for adoption if she didn't want to get rid of you? There'd be no reason to try and find you... unless- no. It couldn't happen. You shift your violin and guitar to your other arm so you can get your key out from your pocket. You look at the tiny key in your hand; the small piece of metal that could mean so much. It meant that 456 High Street was your home. That Mary and Dave are your parents, not some mystery lady with your color hair. Besides, you didn't even know for sure it was her. It could be any one. For all you know, your Mom could be dead. You open the door.
13122.title: It can't be her... right?

choices: Dave and Mary come while you're eating with a friend
Dave and Mary come while you're eating alone
131221.content:
You go into your room, not looking into any of the rooms you pass. You take out your guitar and strum a few notes absently. It's not like she ever gave you a reason to want to know. Like you said before: It wouldn't be that hard to find someone with black hair and amber eyes, named Lianna for that matter. You know that must be the name your mother gave you, when you were in the orphanage your name was Lianna.

You shake your head, trying to stop thinking about her. You finally listen to what you're playing. It's "I'm already there" by Lonestar. For some reason you always end up playing that when you think about Her.
"'I'm already there'. Well, when you finally decide to tell me where 'there' is, don't. I don't really want to know. My life is already hard enough as it is without you deciding to listen to your mothering instincts." You put your guitar away and go into the kitchen to make a sandwich.
131221.title: Food

1312211.content:
You hear the front door open, Dave and Mary are home.
"Come on in, Lianna should be home soon," You hear Dave say. You get up and quitly go to your room. You finish your sandwich and turn the small T.V in your room to MTV. You turn the volume up almost all the way and get out your guitar and play along with what's playing right now.
"Lianna?" Mary shouts from the other side of the door.
"No, it's Jack the Ripper," you say jokingly, Dave and Mary don't really care what you and you don't really they do, but you don't hate each other. Mary opens the door as you turn off the T.V, "Come out to the living room. Someone's here to see you." She steps out of the way.
"Whatever it is I didn't do it, I was with the band. That's the truth." You let Mary lead you to the living room.
"You'll tell me what you did to make you say that later." On the couch is Dave and...
1312211.title: Someone to see you

13122112.content:
Sitting on the couch is a tall, thin woman. She has blond hair streaked with grey pulled into a tight knot on the back of her head. She has large glasses framing her dull-blue eyes. The wrinkles on her face show you that she is very old. The grim look in her eyes and the pursed line of her lips look odly familiar as she stares at you.
"Well, you've grown just as I thought you would: too short and gangly. And WHAT have you done with your hair?" the old lady snapped.
"Excuse me!" you say angrily. How dare she treat you like this? You don't even know her, at least not that you remember.
"And what horrible manners! Did you teach her ANYTHING? I knew we should never had given her to you!" she said, glaring at Dave and Mary.
"Why don't we get down to why you came here?" Mary said angrily.
"Yes, we should," said the old lady. You know that angry glare somewhere.
"Hello, I don't believe you remember me-"
"No, we don't." You snap.
"I am Mrs. Krensington, the director of the American Adoption Association.
"Oh.." that's where you know her from!
13122112.title: Mrs. Krensington

choices: Turn and see who it is
131221121.content:
You lean against the door frame and cross your arm over you chest, waiting for whatever news to come so you can leave.
"I've come to make sure you aren't treating Lianna badly."

You answer your question, truthfully. You like it here. All the freedom, and despite the jokes you like Dave and Mary and they like you.
After that lady(you've forgotten her name already)leaves Dave askes, "Did you have with her for two years?" You nod in mock sadness. He quickly hugs you, "I'm so sorry."
Once he lets you go you say, "I'm going to the park, be back around sunset. Maybe after." You grab your violin case and leave.

As you wait for sunset you play your violin. You don't know what your playing, it's a tune of some sort. It always fills you with a sence of peace.
After awhile, after sunset and you are thinking about staying out a bit longer, you can tell someone is comeing up behind you, something you've learned from having to run from bullies almost every day.
131221121.title: Sunset and strangers

1312211212.content: You stop playing and turn around. You reconize the black hair and the top of the head, it's the stranger that likes country(you refuse to think about what your friends said). They're wearing a t-shirt and jeans, much like your sleeveless shirt and jeans, with a small design in the front.
1312211212.title: It's that person!

14.content:
Everyone cheers, someone scored. You make your way under the bleachers. You go to the frist few rows of bleachers and look through the space. You reach into someones back pocket and pull out their wallet. You pull out 28 dollars, leaving a few bills still in the wallet, and slip it back in the persons pocket. You go from person to person grabing thrie wallets, taking some money and putting the wallet back.

You've made to the top bleachers, by climbing, by the time halftime comes. You slip someones wallet back and put the dollar bills in your pocket when someone pulls you down. You can't see who the person is but hear them you know instantly, "What are you doing?"
It's...
14.title: The game

142.content:
John Davidson is standing over you.
"What do care?" you ask, getting up. John pushes you down again, "I said, what are you doing?"
"Nothing, I like it here," you mutter.
"Didn't look like nothing to me."
142.title: Caught

1421.content:
You get up and back away, "Then you're stupider than you look."
"You take that back!" John hisses. You jump to the side as he lunges at you. You trip him and...
1421.title: Fight?

14211.content:
John is a lot stronger then you and beat you to a pulp, and has. You run out from under the bleachers. After a while you run into someone, falling over.
"Where's the fire?" A female asks.
Who is it?
14211.title: Running

choices: Wander the streets until Dave and Mary have gone to sleep
14212.content:
You raise you fists, "You know, John, half time is gonna end. Shouldn't you get back out there?"
Someone grabs you from behind and for the next few seconds John beats you to a pulp.
As John and Chris, his minion, leave John says, "That's only half of it. Wait till I see you again." You get up and gingerly feel your bloody nose and the cuts over bother eyebrows. You try to get a much dust off you as you can.

Now what? Dave and Mary are gonna be home and they'll make a big deal about this.
14212.title: The beating

142122.content:
This event has already ruined your evening; the overreaction sure to come from Dave and Mary would no doubt destroy any residual fond memories of the day. Your only choice is to wait until they have gone to sleep before returning home.

As you leave the school's stadium all you can think about is how if Chris had not blind sided you, you would have had more than a fighting chance of turning the tables and making John think twice before interfering in your business again. Next time things will not go so smoothly for him. Unfortunately, your daydreams of revenge are interrupted by a blinding pain as you notice for the first time the rather large bruise on your left side. Realizing how dirt and blood covered your face must be, you make your way to the closest gas station. The bathroom is filthy, but it contains a working sink with fairly clean water and plenty of paper towels.

You clean your cuts as well as con be expected in a gas station bathroom. Looking at your watch you figure that Dave and Mary should be settling into bed soon enough. So you decide to head home now, but you'll take the long way just to be sure to avoid any unpleasant encounters at home. Still angry about the unfair beating you had just received, you push the door open much harder than intended and it slams into a person standing outside the door waiting to use the bathroom.

"Oh I am so sorry," you begin to stammer. The stranger is wearing a long black cloak and the hood is up. Cast in shadow you cannot make out any details of the face, and the cloak disguises the body type and sex. You see the stranger raise his or her gloved hand to silence your apology.

"That is quite alright. I shouldn't have been standing so close." The voice is so muffled you must strain to understand the words, and still you are given no indication of the gender of this stranger. He or she backs into the bathroom and closes the door. As you turn around to head home you can't help but notice that no new cars have pulled up to the gas station. Who was that and why is he or she at a gas station without a car? This person must have walked here, but from where - you've never seen this person or anyone like him, her, it before.

Thoughts of the mysterious stranger consume your walk home. With home in sight you sigh with relief as you notice the lights are out. However, when you are two houses away you swear you hear the faint sound of footsteps a very short distance behind you. You spin around but see no one; instead you do catch a glimpse of a figure, a shadow darting behind a tree a couple of lawns away. Both the sound of footsteps and the shadow gone, you rush the rest of the way home and into your room.
142122.title: Shadows

info.brief_description: Is Liannas mother really coming to find her?
info.description:
Lianna is sixteen years old, with pitch-black hair with silver streaks dyed in, and bright amber eyes, with just the slightest touch of green. She doesn't have many friends and doesn't really care. Her foster parents, Dave and Mary, couldn't care less about what happened to her.
Lee thinks her father is dead and can't remember what her mother looked like. She loves to sing and despite her punk exterior she likes country, she even owns a cowboy hat and pair of cowboy boots. Lee and her friends have a band, really all they do is play what the crowd wants on a street courner. Lianna plays the guitar and violin.
Events happen in this story that lead Lianna and her friends to believe that her mother is looking for her. But does Lianna really want to meet her?

Please, please, PLEASE, GIVE ME YOUR IMPUT AND ADD CHAPTERS!!!!
